reviews.title: A surprise in East Berlin
reviews.text: This hotel is situated five metro stops from Alexanderplatz at Samariterstrasse in East Berlin. The area is not smart but appears to be developing. The streets leading off Frankfurterallee are a little gloomy but not threatening. The hotel is situated about a block from the U-bahn and is smartly painted and newly renovated. Our room was in an annexe of four across a small courtyard from the main building and was very quiet. The reception staff, with the exception of one girl who was unfriendly and unsmiling, were pleasant and helpful. The room was a good size and well furnished with a bright modern bathroom with good quality fittings. Breakfast was generous and good quality and we appreciated the free Internet access min the foyer. We stayed at the hotel for five nights in late February 2006 and for E55 per night including breakfast we felt it was very good value and would stay here again.

We discovered this hotel through Trip Advisor which we found to be a brilliant resource for booking 9 hotels on our 5-week trip through Europe. We weren't disappointed with any of our choices and we felt we got excellent value everywhere.
reviews.title: Great for the price!

reviews.text: We have been travelling from Canada to Europe a lot lately (Dublin, London, Riga, Paris and Berlin in the last 8 months), and this is the best hotel we have stayed at so far for the price.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: While the neighbourhood is still fairly East Berlin circa 1990, the location one block from the U-bahn (subway) is really convenient to get anywhere in Berlin.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel in Berlin

reviews.text: Our room was big, contemporary and clean, with nice thick walls (we had quite thin ones in Paris). We never ran out of hot water for showers and the bathroom floor was heated. The continental breakfast buffet was great and available until 10:00, and included hot scrambled and boiled eggs in addition to the usual cereal, breads, meats and cheeses.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For value for money this is without doubt one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. My husband asked me not to write a review but to keep this one a secret. My whole experience of Berlin was fantastic. First class hotel, first class people and first class city. I hope it does not get ruined like a lot of the other cities with the stag and hen parties.
reviews.title: Want to keep this one a secret
Very positive experience
reviews.text: The hotel is all the other reviews said and the area is fine. I never felt threathened or unsafe anywhere. In fact after Barcelona and Rome where everyone warned us about the thieves and we were always worried about something happening, Berlin was very relaxed and safe.

Make sure you have your ticket for the underground. The inspectors wear plain clothes and were on the trains all the time. There is an instant 40 euro fine. A 72 hour pass costs 19 euro 90 cent and that gives you unlimited travel on trains, buses, trams and underground and these can be purchased in the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice, great price

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. After reading the other reviews, I had some concerns about the area, but found the area to be perfectly fine. For the money, the hotel was a great value. Our room was large and clean, and breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful in directing us. Unless you are a traveler who needs to have all the main sights right outside your door, the location is great. It's just a few minute walk to the U-Bahn stop and easy access to all the major sights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
nice hotel could do with a few improvements
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned yesterday from an excellent 4 day trip to this fine hotel and city. My wife was a bit dubious when she heard the price of a one night stay, thinking it would be cheap and nasty. €154 - 3 nights! Meanwhile I had faith in the comments from fellow members, most of whom had nothing particulary bad to say. My wife was more than happy with everything about the hotel and location, thank god!
reviews.title: Great value hotel in a great value city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room at the front of the hotel which was a decent size, spotlessly clean and also quiet. The local s-bahn station was quite rightly as said before about 200 yards away. From here Berlin is really accessable and quite easy to commute around. We managed to master the u-bah and s-bahn systems but didn't really have time to work out the trams & buses, maybe next time. We found Berlin to be the most reasonably priced capital city we have been to and will certainly be back next year as you can't see it all in 4 days.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring \berlin
Great value hotel & Lively area
reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Agon Frankfurter Allee. Good clean comfortable Hotel with friendly english speaking staff. We got there early, 11am, expecting to just drop our case in the luggage room but, to our surprise, they had a room available straight away. Good location for exploring Berlin - Samariterstrasse tube station literally less the 200 yards away. Taxi from Tegel airport approx 30-35 mins - 20 - 25€. Plenty of reasonably priced good quality eateries nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely worthwhile and great value. They even have a free internet terminal in reception!
reviews.title: Great value in an area with good amenities

likes.liked: — Location to places to eat / drink at night
likes.disliked: — lack of interesting decor in room

reviews.text: Just got back yesterday from 4 days in Berlin, having read all the other reviews on the city and the Hotel Agon before our trip.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: I wasn't quite sure about the hotel when I booked it. I booked it on the basis of the good reviews here and was impressed on arrival. The staff are good, breakfast is more than adequate, even though the breakfast area has the feel of a university canteen about it. The bar area is small but I never saw anyone using it during my stay.
reviews.title: Very impressed

likes.disliked: — Graffiti strewn buildings around the hotel

reviews.title: Excellent value
reviews.text: The room I had overlooked the car park at the back of the hotel, it was comfortable and clean although would not have been suitable for a couple (twin beds toe to toe).

reviews.title: a "gem"of an hotel
reviews.text: The hotel itself certainly stood out in the area, it's been renovated and looks a little out of place in a run down part of the old East Berlin. But the area is perfectly safe, and within easy reach of Samaritser Strasse U-bahn station.

reviews.title: decent for the money
reviews.text: Yes, there are hotels with a better location in relation to the city centre, but this is a good hotel and I would stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a short stay of 2 nights in this hotel and my wife and I were impressed. Large,clean room,substantial breakfast and a short walk to the underground and the quick connections to Alexanderplatz. Thoroughly recommended ,especially for slightly older guests,like us.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I agree with the traveller from Durham, NC. This hotel is great. I did have a slight problem finding it, but the Durham, NC directions are spot-on. This hotel is modern, clean and the breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had travelling. I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Outstanding value in a great location
Bedroom or broom cupboard?
reviews.text: Having read the reports on this website we were expecting the twin bed situation in place of the usual double bed. What we didn't expect was a tiny room with the beds laid end to end! The placement of the rest of the furniture in the room (all screwed into the wall and floor) meant we could not rearrange the room and only just managed to get the beds in side by side (but without access to the wardrobe). We complained at Reception and were greeted with a decidely frosty response and informed that "their was nothing they could do" and the reason our room was so small was because we had "booked through Expedia and not directly with the hotel". As this was a part of a birthday trip for my partner, you can imagine how angry we were at being treated as second class citizens!

reviews.title: Excellent Value in Berlin
reviews.text: At least the buffet was nice!

reviews.title: What a Great Choice
reviews.text: Just returned from a four night stay at Agon Frankfurter Allee. I was very pleased and would recommend the hotel to most travellers. For the price the accommodations were excellent. Everything was new and spotlessly clean. The room was basic but had more furnishings than most European budget hotels. The bathroom was extremely nice and typical of a more expensive room. All rooms have only showers; the sink had surrounding surface area and shelves above. (Bring facial tissues and bar soap if you require them, as only liquid soap is provided.) Don't be put off by the location. It is perfectly safe and convienient to all parts of the city, given the superb public transportation system. On finding the hotel (as previous instructions can be misinterpreted): as you take U-Bahn from Alexanderplatz, exit train to right, at end of platform take exit to right, at top you will be 30-40 feet from corner of Frankfurter Allee and Kinzigstrasse, turn right on Kinzigstrasse, at end of block turn left, hotel is 1/2 way down on left side of this street. Only a 5 minute walk. Staff friendly, breakfast buffet has a wide selection. All in all, a wise choice. I've been to Berlin several times and have paid three times as much for a fancier, but not necessarily better, room.

reviews.title: excellent value for money
reviews.text: Having never visited Berlin, and with the city being so huge, I was clueless to the best location to stay. My comments would be, that you are not by any of the main tourist sites nor are you too far away either. You are just 5 U Bahn (subway) stops away from Alexander Platz. The area around the hotel has been described as rough. Well I would not be concerned going out at any hour of the day with any of my belongings and feel intimidated. The area is much like any other area. I don't think I saw one threatening or worrying looking person in my whole time in Berlin. Unlike most of Britains major towns or cities the people of Berlin seem to respect personal belongings. Many times I saw people leave their bags unattended, and their shopping on their bicycles, their bicycles unlocked, video screens on the subway unvandalised. It seems that respect of property and law and order prevails strongly still in this part of the world. The people are friendly and seem genuine and warm. There is grafitti around the hotel as there is everywhere, even in the poshest of districts there seems no room left anywhere to leave a tag. The trees, the pavement, the roads are heavily marked with spray paint.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. The room and other areas were _really_ clean. Beds were good and the staff was nice. Facilities included all you will need, but nothing beyond that, e.g. there were no decent bar in the hotel. Although, there are plenty of them near hotel. The breakfast was something you would expect from a decent hotel. U-bahn station was just a block away, so it's easy to getting around. Friedrichhain is a nice neighbourhood if you don't mind some ugly buildings occupied by squatters and graffities all over the places. As said there are lot of bars, restaurants and small shops just few blocks from the hotel. It was really value for money.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in June. It was hard to find from the directions online, but when we finally did get there, it was very close to the metro station. It wasn't in a great neighborhood (there was an abandoned park nearby with some homeless people living in it), lots of graffiti, etc. The hotel was very clean. There was no flat sheet on the bed (which we found was common), but it looked like they wash the cover often. The double bed was 2 twins pushed together (also common). The TV had 2 English channels, MTV and CNN. There was free internet in the lobby, which we thought was great! The staff was helpful and spoke english well. There was an elevator.
reviews.title: Good deal!

likes.disliked: — No fan or AC in room (we like to have a little noise at night)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was really good. There was an assortment of breads, meat, cheese, cereal, yogurt, juice, fruit, hot drinks and was buffet style.
reviews.title: Small, Friendly and Good Value for money hotel

likes.liked: — Clean modern room with walk in shower - easy access to public transport

reviews.text: The bedroom was larger than expected. The windows opened out to the street below, but we closed them at night and had no problem with noise. The bathroom was really clean and nice. It was modernly decorated and looked really nice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Location and High Quality of rooms etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we thought the hotel was really good and well worth the price we paid.
reviews.title: Cheap & Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a very comfortable hotels, very cheap with breakfast included. Beds can be joined to simulate a double. You can control the temperature in the room, the baths are new and have liquid soap. The hotel is very close to the underground.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband an I stayed here when I took him to Berlin for his birthday. We had a fabulous time: the hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff were helpful. It is tucked away a little bit but there's plenty of nearby shops, restaurants and bars. We were fairly new to travelling at the time and were fairly proud of ourselves for making it from Tegel on the bus and U-Bahn, thought it did test my schoolgirl German a bit. Loved every minute of our stay though and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Fab little hotel

likes.disliked: — It is probably only able to function because of Berlin's phenomenal transport system: it's a bit off the beaten track.

reviews.text: We were a little hesitant in booking this hotel, given its off the beaten path location. However, it was an excellent surprise!
reviews.title: Great stay in eastern Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was close to the S-bahn station Frankfurter Allee (5-10 minute walk), and was even closer to the U-bahn station (2 minutes). You can get anywhere you'd like to go downtown within 15 or 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Great hotel for exploring Berlin
A Great Value Hotel
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our rooms, and the amenities such as the heated tile bathroom floor. Also, the breakfast was the best we have had at a European hotel with a full hot and cold buffet.

Hotel Frankfurter Allee (surprisingly not on Frankfurter Allee!) is a well run, clean, economically-priced and pleasant place to stay. It has charm and character and most of the staff are very friendly.
reviews.title: Allee ist gut!

reviews.text: The bar (which doubles as a reception area) is a disappointment, though.
reviews.title: Great choice for Berlin

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful (no problem with English speaking there).
reviews.title: Excellent value, good location

likes.liked: — Helpful staff and free internet access
likes.disliked: — No airdryer in the room (but available on request)

reviews.text: There's free Internet (one station only) near the reception - very helpful (tip: the PC is usually free at night).
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great city, Great holiday

likes.liked: — Very clean, modern, and close to the U-Bahn for access to the city centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good - about 200 meters to a U-bahn station to Alexander Platz (5-10 minute ride).
reviews.title: Fantastic budget place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week in this hotel, and were disappointed by the room. It was very small, and the beds were positioned foot - to -foot, which would ok if it was two friends, but I was with my boyfriend!! Also, the walls & ceiling were like paper, and we were woken on a few occasions by other guests coming in late in the evening. Having said that, the room was very clean, and the bathroom was lovely.
reviews.title: My opinion of Hotel Agon Frankfurter Allee

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good - there was a good selection of rolls, meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, yoghurt & coffee.
reviews.title: Good city base

reviews.text: The hotel was very handy to the U-bahn station, from which we were able to make our way all over berlin, quickly & easily. There were plenty of restaurants nearby, especially on boxhagner street, which is two minutes walk away. The area looks a bit dodgy, but it is totally fine for walking around - and is quiet most of the time - we never saw anyone that we were a bit wary of walking past.
reviews.title: Value 4 Money!!

likes.disliked: — the heating was a little to high although the staff sorted it once we brought it to their attention

reviews.text: I felt the pictures of the hotel on the website were a bit misleading - the room we stayed in certainly didnt look like that!! And the bar etc is not as big as it would seem in the pictures either.
reviews.title: Highly recommended, Great value

likes.disliked: — parking area too close to apartments may create some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a shopping centre nearby, on Frankfurter Allee, which had a good range of shops, and is also beside another U-bahn station.
reviews.title: Agon Frankfurter Allee excellent value for money
